subject  follow up mark  over the past several month vince and paul have had some contact with the author of this upcoming risk management book  vince and his group are writing a chapter and the forward  and enron australia will contribute au     in support of the book  there are a number of apparent legal issue associated with completing  publicizing this book and marge suggested that this is an area of interest to you  i handle public relation for apachi and will try to contact you within the next couple of day to seek your guidance  thanks  john                       forwarded by john ambler  enron _ development on         pm                            lacima on           pm to  john ambler  enron _ development  enron _ development cc  subject  follow up hi john  nice talking with you last week  the following are some of the item that we discussed during own phone call   attached is a copy of the introduction of the book  section    provides a content overview  we are planning to market the book globally  and feel the market size is around   the author name are dr chris stickland and dr le clewlow  mini bio of author  dr  le clewlow and dr chris strickland hold associate research position at both the school of finance and economics  university of technology  sydney and the financial option research centre  university of warwick  uk  together  they have over  year combined experience in the financial and energy derivative market and have published many article in academic and trade journal  they are the author of the book  implementing derivative model   wiley    and editor of  exotic option  the state of the art   itp     their forthcoming book  energy derivative  pricing and risk management  is due to be published during the second quarter   currently  their interest are concentrated in the energy derivative area  where they have developed a wide range of pricing tool for electricity option and other energy derivative  could you please provide response to the following   would it be ok if we use the logo for enron  the global company   what will you need from u before printing  if you need to review the book jacket or the manuscript  please let u know   if enron need to review anything  how long will it take for enron to turn it around   we are putting together a leaflet advertising our energy course  we would like to mention the forthcoming book and that it is being sponsored by enron    is this ok with you  no logo will be used   we would like to produce a leaflet  brochure advertising the book a well  but this will follow after we have the book cover designed  should i work with andrew at stokes account ex  on this   how do we handle the money side of thing  the manuscript is not fully completed  but we may begin typesetting any day now  i think it will take about    week to typeset and then another  week to print and bind  sometime in late april  it look like we will be in houston around the  th of march    will you be around either the  th or  th  i hope you are enjoying your time at home  let me know if you need anything further  take care  julie  intro  zip

subject  hedging lng volume stinson  vince  i think this is important to know  regard  sandeep                        forwarded by sandeep kohli  enron _ development on         am                            anshuman srivastav           am to  marc de la roche  ect cc  tushar dhruv  enron  doug leach  ect  mohan gurunath  enron _ development  enron _ development  rajesh sivaraman  enron _ development  enron _ development  shubh shrivastava  enron _ development  enron _ development  mukesh tyagi  enron _ development  enron _ development  bcc  sandeep kohli  enron _ development  subject  hedging lng volume hi marc  dpc would like a swap to hedge it price expsoure on lng  we do understand that there exists a basis risk between jcc  the lng spa index  and brent  the market index for the product  and will bear such risk  we also appreciate the fact that this is a financial product and irrespective of actual consumption  we will still have to bear the burden  if any  of the swap  fuel  lng indexed to jcc  closely correlated to brent future  period volume  tbtu  volume  mt  volume  jcc bbl  january  to december             january  to december             january  to december             crude swap price  can we look at a  dirty  hedge and get a crude    bbl  swap price  like any other regular swap  this will be a monthly settle product  the above conversion from mt to bbl are based on lng conversion factor      bbl  mt   we also would like to understand the requirement of the credit group to put this hedge in place  please indicate the process a well a the security mechanism to provide adequate credit support for the swap  please call me     or rajesh     for any additional info  regard  anshuman

subject  west power model lance and i spoke with tim heizenrader regarding modeling work and need for the west desk  the difference in the market between east and west are  in tim  s opinion  sufficient that he doe not need an approach a sophisticated a the one we are pursuing for ercot  in particular  the termal limit for which load flow are so useful are not generally binding in the west  loop flow are also not considered a major issue at present  in summary  it seems that the west is an unlikely customer of any extension to an ercot  east transmission model for the time being  they have also done little in this area that would directly relate to our effort here  martin

subject  request for training session folk  i am a vice president with enron  and have been with the company some  year now  i wa hired through enron associate pool  and started off by marketing power on the east coast with jim fallon  currently i am working in the india region  looking into different way to develop merchant type activity in india  anticipating the start of trading activity some time in the future  one of my challenge is to make the team in india aware of the type of sophisticated operation and process that we have in place for trading activity  a well a the range of product we have to offer  i have been in conversation with mike mcconnell and jeff shankman on the global product side  and are planning a session to acquaint the team in india with activity in that group  similarly  on the power side  we have been interacting with john sherriff  s team in london  i feel that it will be very beneficial for some of the team member to get acquainted with the process on the power trading side in houston  and to get an idea of the rac process  the research side  the back  office  a well a the trading operation here  similarly  the team there could present to you the state of the market in india  and give you an idea of the type of opportunity there  i am therefore eliciting your support to put together a session in houston where they can be acquainted with these function  a well a the people responsible for them in the u  there are three people in the group who would benefit from this exposure  one of them is from the associate pool  while the other two are people hired locally in india  i have already spoken with our coo  wade cline in this regard  and seek your support in putting together an agenda for such a session  please let me know who i should contact within your group to discus this further  regard  sandeep

subject  enron earth day  trash bash  enron is hosting a special event on saturday  march  st  the first annual enron  trash bash  to clean up the bank of buffalo bayou between shepherd drive and sam houston park  i am chairing the check  in team which consists of  registering all of the volunteer handing out enron t  shirt and cap passing out glove and garbage bag making clean up section assignment for anyone who might be interested in helping me  please call me at ext    also  we need a lot of volunteer to walk along buffalo bayou and pick up trash  this would be a great family project  a good project for your child youth group or boy scout or girl scout troop  it will also be fun  they will have live band  lyou get an enron t  shirt and enron baseball cap  lunch will be served at sam houston park and there are a lot of good door prize  if you want to volunteer for the  trash bash  clean up  just show up at sam houston park on saturday  march     at  am to register  clean up start at  am and lunch will be served at    am and after lunch door prize will be drawn and then you can go home feeling like you have done your part for houston  s waterway environment  i hope you will think about it and bring your friend  family  ect  and help enron clean up the environment  thanks  anita

subject  organizational change change in enron  s business require u to reevaluate how we approach the engineering and construction function within enron  specifically  enron energy service   ee  business ha grown dramatically and that requires considerable additional engineering and construction resource both to develop solution for customer and to deliver those solution to customer  additionally  in light of enron  s continued emphasis on increasing our return on invested capital  we have been engaged in fewer large scale construction project around the world  historically  these project have been a primary focus of eecc  s activity  consequently we are making the following organizational change concerning eecc  eecc  s pipeline construction group  led by jerry martin  will become part of enron transportation service  nepco will continue to operate a a stand alone entity focused on power plant construction service to enron entity and third party  the remainder of eecc will become part of ee  larry izzo will report to the ee office of the chairman  these change will better align our intellectual capital with the growth opportunity within enron and provide new and exciting opportunity for our employee  please join u in supporting and implementing these change

subject  hurricane warning derivative folk  this note is intended to update all who may be concerned on our progress toward developing a commercial hurricane warning derivative product or line of product  it is clear that numerous entity have underlying exposure to hurricane warning frequency and  or duration  it is our objective to develop derivative product that will enable these entity to effectively hedge this exposure  we have generated a partial brainstorm  style list of whom natural counterparties might be according to their underlying exposure  pro  hurricane anti  hurricane the weather channel resort home depot cruise ship lowes riverboat casino cnn chemical plant and refinery local tv station u  s armed force dry ice manufacturer athletic team chainsaw manufacturer city government insect repellant manufacturer state government it is obvious that there are numerous naturally offsetting party but it is important to note that the pro  hurricane entity are more macro in nature while the anti  hurricane entity are typically more regional  thus  we have documented the frequency and duration data by regional location with the thought that the anti  hurricane entity would be interested in regional product and the pro  hurricane entity would likely be more interested in bundled regional product depending on their exposure  thus far  we have collected and documented all u  s hurricane warning data from    in the form of an excel database  the data can be sorted by year  storm  or location on the u  s coastline  total hurricane warning duration a well a number of discrete hurricane warning are the primary data set of interest for any given location  or year or storm   the u  s coast ha been divided into  different geographic region of roughly similar size  these region are  new england  mid  atlantic  virginia  north carolina  georgia  south carolina  east florida  west florida  florida panhandle  orleans  miss  bama  lousiana  and texas  while this data set may not yet be sufficient for price modeling purpose  it ha confirmed our expectation that hurricane warning frequency and duration is quite volatile and unpredictable  it is believed that this volaility  when graphically depicted and mathematically represented  could be used to effectively demonstrate to would  be customer the impact of hurricane warning frequency on their business financials  in many case  business may be well aware of their exposure but may not have quantified it and certainly probably felt a if this wa a risk they would have to wear themselves  a we move forward on the modeling front  the data will certainly need to be scrutinized to correct for any skewing factor such a political trend  satellite availability  population trend  etc  additionally  we need to go further back in time so long a the accuracy doesn  t decline  on the marketing front  i am certainly open to idea  it is believed the weather channel would be the most natural party for such a product  given our positive relationship that we currently have with them  they might be the easiest sell  any and all idea are welcome with regard to how and when we should approach customer  please respond with any question  comment or concern on this project  thanks  charlie

subject  re  var vince thanks for the update  especially your point  which echo our own discussion yesterday  i want to clarify responsibility for maintenance and administration of var  we need transparency around the process so that mapping decision  for example  are easily made  supported and reviewed  it became clear after last friday  s event  that we are in an awkward paradigm with respect to how we handle var here  particularly at  pressure point   i am putting together the scope of a  general overhaul  of the var process  including method and administration  to which i hope we would all buy in  so be assured of our co  operation  dp      original message      from  kaminski  vince sent  wednesday  april       pm to  port  david cc  lavorato  john  kaminski  vince  tamarchenko  tanya subject  var david  during today  s var coordination meeting we had a discussion of issue related to mapping of the forward price curve into core location  mapping is a necessity dictated by the limitation of the computer system  we have to reduce the dimensionality of the problem to stay within the bound of available cpu memory  also  in some case the quality of price discovery is poor and it  s difficult to model the price curve independently  we solve the problem by mapping them into more liquid and better behaved core location curve  we have agreed on the following    winston will investigate the it side and determine to what extent we can increase the number of forward price curve that are simulated a basic  core  curve  he will investigate the impact of a larger number of the core curve on the time required to complete the var run    the curve associated with the biggest    position in each commodity should be modeled a core curve  i  e  no mapping into other location   it make sense to monitor the biggest risk separately and avoid aggregating them into le transparent aggregate    the result of an automated clustering  mapping  procedure should be systematically monitored by a human and corrected if they misrepresent the risk of the trading position  this responsibility should be vested with one person  right now the responsibility is dispersed through the organization and this mean in practice that nobody is responsible   research can allocate one person to this task  cooperation of trading and rac will be critical  vince

subject  energy book vl   vince  i have rewritten the paragragh for chapter   please read and return your comment  thanks  grant                        forwarded by grant masson  hou  ect on         pm                            chris strickland on           am to  grant masson  ect  vkamins  ect cc  subject  energy book hi grant  hope all is well with you  i trust you got my message via the voicemail that ileft with vince late friday afternoon about my inability to travel  i  m trying to rearrange my trip for a couple of week  s time when my ear ha cleared up  and i look forward to meeting with you one day  i wrote to vince last week asking for a favour  but i  m not sure ifhe is there in houston  i know that you guy are probably very busy but i wa wondering if you can write a few sentence for me  i  m sending out some sample chapter to the people who responded positively  all of them   to my request for some feedback on the book  chapter  ha an  overview  of the book with just a couple of sentence on each chapter  could you please write a sentence or two for your chapter  i  m including what i have already written  although i think it ha changed slightly from this version  so that you can see the style  many thanks and best regard  chris   overview of this book this book aim to provide an in  depth understanding of the pricing and risk management of energy derivative  in the remainder of this chapter we give an overview of the fundamental principal needed to model and price energy asset  and which underlie the rest of the book  a well a introducing the technique that underlie the black  scholes modelling framework we discus the numerical technique of trinomial tree and monte carlo simulation for derivative pricing which are used extensively later in the book  in chapter  we analyse spot energy price  apart from describing empirical price we propose a number of process that can be used to model the price  we look at the well  know process of gbm a well a mean reversion  stochastic volatility and jump process  discussing each  and showing how they can be simulated and their parameter estimated  chapter   written by vince kaminski  grant masson and ronnie chahal of enron corporation  discus volatility estimation in energy commodity market  this chapter build on the previous one  it examines in detail the method  merit and pitfall of the volatility estimation process assuming different pricing model introduced in chapter   example from crude  gas  and electricity market are used to illustrate the technical and interpretative aspect of calculating volatility  chapter  examines forward curve in the energy market  although such curve are well understood and straight forward in the world debt market the difficulty of storage in many energy market lead to le well defined curve  what we do in this chapter chapter  present an overview of the common and not  so  common derivative structure in the energy market and discus their us  example of product analysed in this chapter include a variety of swap  cap  floor and collar  a well a energy swaptions  compound option  asian  or average rate  option  barrier  lookbacks  and ladder option  chapter  investigates single and multi  factor model of the energy spot price and the pricing of some standard energy derivative  closed form solution for forward price  forward volatility  and european option price are derived and presented for all the model in this chapter including a three factor stochastic convenience yield and interest rate model with jump  chapter  show how the price of path dependent and american style option can be evaluated for the model in chapter   simulation scheme are developed for the evaluation of european style option and applied to a variety of path dependent option  in order to price option which incorporate early exercise opportunity  a trinomial tree scheme is developed  this tree is built to be consistent with the observed forward curve and can be used to price exotic a well a standard american style option  chapter  develops a new methodology for valuing energy option based on modelling the market observed forward curve  the approach result in a multi  factor model that is able to capture realistically the evolution of a wide range of energy forward curve and where the user defined volatility structure can be of an extremely general form  closed  form solution are developed for pricing standard european option and efficient monte carlo scheme for exotic option  the chapter finish with a discussion of the valuation of american style option  chapter  focus on the risk management of energy derivative position  in this chapter we discus the management of price risk for institution that sell option or other derivative to a client and who is then faced with the problem of managing the risk through time  we begin with delta hedging a portfolio containing derivative and look at extension to gamma hedging  using the model from chapter  and   the general model of chapter  ideally suited to multi  factor hedging and this is also discussed  chapter  look at the key risk  management concept of value at risk applied to portfolio containing energy derivative portfolio  after discussing the concept of the measure  we look at how the key input  volatility  covariance  correlation  etc  can be estimated  we then compare the four major methodology for computing var  delta  delta  gamma  historical simulation and monte  carlo simulation  finally  we look at testing the var estimate for various underlying energy market variable

subject  organization announcement given the growth in ee it ha become apparent that it is time to consolidate the risk function between ee and ew  this will provide ee with the system  resource and risk expertise of the wholesale energy group necessary for it to continue to grow and take advantage of current market opportunity  with this in mind and in agreement with the management of ee  two new risk group inside enron america will be formed to provide ee with pricing  structuring  retail and wholesale commodity risk management  logistics and back  office service  these group main function is to provide these service to ee  we have asked rogers herndon  currently vice president  trading in the eastern power group to manage this function in the eastern interconnect  this includes both gas and power   rogers will continue to report to kevin presto  we have asked don black  formerly vice president  ee risk management and sourcing  to manage this function in the western u  s  don will manage this group from houston and will report to tim belden  these group will work very closely with ee to pursue shared goal while ensuring close coordination with the wholesale gas and power trading organization  these change are effective immediately  please congratulate rogers and don on their new role  john lavorato  louise kitchen

subject  the storage revolution ha begun network world fusion focus  amy larsen decarlo on storage in the enterprise today  s focus  the storage revolution ha begun      dear wincenty kaminski  today  s focus  the storage revolution ha begun by amy larsen decarlo believe the hype  we are in the middle of a storage revolution  virtually overnight  business have gone from storing gigabyte to terabyte of data  and the number of user accessing that information is skyrocketing  the subsequent requirement are forcing company to rethink their storage strategy and to recognize the importance of storage management in the equation of efficient information delivery  it isn   t just the volume of data or the higher scalability demand that are changing how business handle storage  the premium that company place on much of their enterprise information is having a profound effect on their storage requirement  business demand fault  tolerant storage system that deliver swift and reliable data access to their employee  supplier and customer  but given the fact that hard disk capacity requirement  on average  double every  month  while processor speed double every  month  company are left with a quandary  how can they manage the proliferation of stored information efficiently enough to compensate for the differential between capacity requirement and processor speed  the simple answer to this question is to institute a well  executed storage management plan that anticipates capacity requirement in advance and leverage the best technology and technique to support those need  bear in mind that the majority of storage cost come not from the equipment but from the implementation and support of those system  there are several way to efficiently manage storage  one of the best route is consolidation that is  pooling resource and managing storage a a system  a opposed to a decentralized collection of file server  this may sound like a throwback to an earlier era  when enterprise storage resided on mainframe  but it   s actually a progressive step  a the consolidation ha more to do with centralizing the planning  management  and ongoing support of storage system than it doe with the physical location of the file  next  it is important to recognize that not all information is equally important to the organization  consequently  storage requirement vary by business application  a in all area of it  it is important to make storage implementation decision based on business need  business trying to more efficiently manage storage are looking for alternative to the distributed file server storage model  they want to speed access to stored file and remove bandwidth  intensive backup and recovery operation from the lan  network  attached storage  na  supply it professional with one answer  giving workstation and server a way to gain direct access to stored data  na device  which have been widely available for year  are optimized to process i  o transaction  though they promise better performance  they don   t remove backup from the transport network  instead  they supply a relatively easy  to  deploy solution to cross  platform storage problem for most heterogeneous environment  many consider storage  area network  san  to be the best long  term answer to current and future storage challenge  because sans are designed with a topology separate from the corporate data network  they alleviate many of the availability and performance issue associated with more traditional storage model  yet  given the early deployment stage most company are still in  many of those capability are still largely untested in a production environment  this newsletter will examine how  through effective storage management  it professional can reduce support cost and improve service delivery to their customer  this newsletter will not focus on item like the least expensive tape drive or the fast tape library  instead  it will look at how business can reduce inefficiency and leverage emerging technology to resolve their particular storage application issue  ultimately  the goal is to identify storage technology option and practice that work in real  world environment  to contact amy larsen decarlo                                amy larsen decarlo is an analyst with enterprise management associate in boulder  colo    http    www   com   a leading analyst and market research firm focusing exclusively on all aspect of enterprise management  she focus on storage management  application management  and security  in her position  she oversees market research and contributes to custom project work in her focal coverage area  prior to joining ema  amy spent five year covering enterprise management for industry trade magazine  including informationweek and data communication  she can be reached at mailto  decarlo   com for related link   click here for network world  s home page  http    www  nwfusion  com the national storage industry consortium  nsic  http    www  nsic  org the distributed management task force  dmtf  http    www  dmtf  org storage system standard working group of the ieee http    www  ssswg  org the ietf subject  performance management process a our existing business grow and new business are created  ease of movement and development of our top talent becomes essential to our success  a you heard at the management conference all officer will be titled  reviewed  promoted  and compensated according to a more standard set of guideline  the process recognizes the intrinsic value of each officer  rather than tying that individual to the value of their specific job or reporting relationship  officer titling ha been standardized throughout enron  there are four level of officer  member of the enron office of the chairman make up level   level  includes all other member of the enron executive committee  level  is made up of managing director  including company president and some senior vice president  level  are vice president and some senior vice president with grandfathered title  this year a common evaluation process is being implemented for level  and level  officer  officer will be evaluated by a committee  through a process referred to a the performance review committee  prc   utilizing a standard set of performance criterion and performance rating  performance committee review will occur twice a year   in july for feedback purpose and at year  end for feedback a well a bonus and total compensation consideration  the executive committee will handle the prc for all level  officer  review of level  officer will occur at the business  unit level first with the result   cross calibrated   by the executive committee and a group of approximately sixteen managing director  the goal of the prc process is to insure a consistent standard for our overall pool of executive talent and to provide a tool to more effectively utilize talent throughout the organization  to further promote consistency the executive committee will consider all promotion in january of each year  exception  internally or externally  will be infrequent  the individual   s performance evaluation will be the starting point for all compensation decision  compensation includes base pay  bonus and long  term award  a long  term program that replaces individual or business unit plan ha been approved and will be communicated to individual before bonus payment are made  in addition to the level  and level  review  business unit  global and corporate cross  functional prc review for director  senior director and general manager have started  this year  end process will be utilized a a benchmark to determine how we further refine the evaluation process at this level in the future  if you should have any question about the process  please direct them to your human resource business unit lead per the following  mary ann long  gpg  x  david oxley  ena  eel  global trading  x  ray bennett  ee  x subject  re  working gas price model vince  i have a simplified version of brad  s model in mind  the  no arbitrage  condition equates trading margin across the country  cost of transmission rise with congestion on the network  wellhead supply is almost completely price  elastic  while burner  tip demand is almost completely price inelastic  storage is rationalized a a perpetual call option  the least time  variant parameter are the cost of injecting and withdrawing gas from storage to the pipeline  followed by the cost of delivering gas from the wellhead to the pipeline  the intermediate  variant parameter are the capacity  dependent cost paid to the pipeline  above shrinkage  for transmission  the most time  variant parameter are the trading margin and the valuation of the storage option  there are  parameter to be estimated at each major node of the betwork  they are identifiable in either of two straightforward way  using a short time series of the last  day price based on the assumed variability mentioned above  or point  estimate   calibration   using only today  s data based on a node  based model of competition between pipeline where pipe with the same region of origination  albeit markedly different terminus  price versus capacity similarly   competing  for outflow  i will write this up for you in scientific word and present it to you at your earliest convenience  clayton

subject  a  a math major vince  thank you so much for meeting with me friday morning about the research group  after leaving your office  i remembered an issue i have had with the analyst  associate program that might be of interest to you  during a texas a  m recruiting meeting  i learned that we have expanded our list of major to include computer science  i wondered why math major were not mentioned  and wa told that there wa not a business need for math major  like liberal art major  they said math major were only considered on a person by person basis  in my opinion  math major have many of the same skill a finance major  and can easily adjust to accounting rotation a well  i did last summer  and finance major in the program are forced to every year   i think that enron is missing out on many qualified candidate by limiting their recruitment effort  at texas a  m the career center asks company for a list of major they are targeting  and only allows those major to sign up for interview through the career center  i sent my resume to enron and asked to be included in the interview process on campus  however  many other math major had not heard of enron or the other company  and assumed that there wa no place for a math major at a company like enron  many math major want to continue their education  become teacher  or work for an actuarial firm  however  many are undecided  we are constantly told of the many business possibility available to math major by our teacher and staff  but many undergraduate are still not sure exactly what math major can contribute in a business environment  by not mentioning math major to the career center  a very simple and inexpensive step   enron is losing out on a very talented pool of people  while it would be nice to get the math major that knew about enron already  had thoroughly researched all company and determined that math major would fit perfectly  and went the extra step to send enron their resume outside the career center system  there are many qualified student who do not do this  and opt for other company who did mention math major  i called a manager in the a  a program to suggest that we consider at least mentioning math major to the career center  i realize that it may cost more to actively pursue them  talk to teacher  and attend math society event  however  i told her that including them at the career center would be very inexpensive for enron  she reiterated that they saw no business need for math major  and that if more upper level people began requesting them  it would be considered  i searched for  mathematics  on the enron job website  and had a surprising number of result  i know that your group could use math major a well  however  this still may be too small a number to merit a focus from the a  a recruiting department  i just wanted to bring it to your attention in case it wa something that you felt should be changed  thanks  heather johnson x

subject  energy finance critique david  here are the review of the ut energy finance program that you requested  from jennifer martinez  mba class of   energy finance taken fall of    the energy finance program  year ago wa very good  especially considering it wa the first year of the program  there were a lot of guest speaker from various energy company who gave u a lot of practical knowledge about the energy industry through case study  lecture  etc  basically  we learned all the same finance concept and tool a in the regular finance class  but all the case and example were energy  related  the professor were good for the most part but didn  t have a great deal of practical industry experience  if i had to guess the reason for decreased participation in the program  i would probably say it is the professor  ronn and titman are great but known a being very technical and quantitative  some student prefer le technical professor and class that aren  t limiting to the energy industry  also  the fact that the class meet for  hour twice a week may not be so appealing  other than those thing  i can  t imagine why there ha been such a drop in enrollment  i especially don  t understand why every single person didn  t drop for enron  i wonder if it ha something to do with international status     from john massey  mba class of   energy finance taken fall of    bottom line  ut business school is great  investment fund  best activity available to student energy finance program  fairly weak  it wa a watered down version of the future option class crossed with a weak finance appendage  the finance teacher wa pathetic  both a poor teacher  ignorant about industry specific analysis  devoid of industry experience  rude to outside lecture  from industry  keith brown wa the only educator that wa any good and he only had a small portion of the class time  way to make better  get teacher with practical industry experience  make it a seminar class  focus on case study  lecture  given by people from industry  promote the class within the business school  i felt like ut did a poor job of internally  to student  promoting the class             from ross mesquita  mba class of   energy finance taken fall of    to be honest  a great majority of the coursework wa not energy specific  when energy application were presented  it seemed more like general finance question were reworded to include energy lingo  we had some very good speaker  but for the most part  i did not feel like the  hour of class had enough energy focus  i assumed that this would get better a the program progressed  one reason that may account for the decline in enrollment is that energy finance is a very specific focus  i would have probably not enrolled in the energy finance program had it been available in my first year  i did not know enough about energy at that time and i had returned to b  school to consider several career option   i  e   investment banking  corporate finance  entrepreneurship  marketing  etc  a a new mba student  i would not want to narrow my window of opportunity to only energy company  here is my perspective and probably something that is true of many mba   my interest in enron brought me to the energy industry and not vice versa            from billy braddock  mba class of   energy finance taken fall of    i wa a participant in the inaugural energy finance program in the fall of   the primary positive to the class revolved around outside panel  instruction  for example  enron sent representative on  separate occasion to discus particular topic  vince kaminski and gary hickerson   other notable speaker were jeff sandefer  independent business consultant and e  p professional   the beacon group  and encap investment  another good speaker wa a professor from ut  s school of engineering  he brought a good perspective a to the  basic  of the energy business  the class wa structured via a team  based instruction approach  with  professor team  teaching a   hour credit course  none of the  professor had any product knowledge of the energy business  of the  professor   were research focussed  tenured with little credibility in  teaching   one of the professor primary focus of research wa fixed income  while the other  were investment and corporate finance  respectively  a is the case for ut  s finance program in general  and energy finance in particular  ut is in dire need of teaching professor  a opposed to research professor  that have the ability to convey finance with practical example and at a level that can be more easily be understood by student without a finance background  particular to the energy program  ut need to have more instruction from energy professional  such a the instructor used for enron  s internal learning program  ie  derivative class  etc                           from bryan williams  mba class of   energy finance taken fall of    i participated in the first energy finance class offered in fall of   at the university of texas  the curriculum wa understandably   rough around the edge   a  wa the first year the energy finance course wa offered  however  the instruction also suffered a none of the instructor had any energy background to speak of  the   credit hour class wa team taught by three tenured professor   two of the three professor have co  authored textbook  and the third professor   s claim to fame is fixed income  a a group  the three professor are research  heavy  a opposed to industry focused   and the team  teaching format did not incent any one of the prof to be personably accountable for the success of the class  that said  the instructor did a good job attracting some top notch outside speaker  among them  vince kaminski  gary hickerson  both of enron  they also dedicated one class period to a video conference call with the beacon group  an energy consulting group that i believe wa recently acquired by goldman  jeff sandefer  an independent businessman  an entreprenuership instructor  and one of the foremost expert in the e  there are some experienced  brand  name professor  e  g  sheridan titman  teaching in the program  con   the program should give the student more exposure to energy company such a enron  specifically  it might need to help student link to the interview oppurtunites from these energy company such a enron  from george huan  mba class of   energy finance taken fall of    company expect mba student to have both general management  new idea  and analytic  quantative  skill  energy industry is no exception  energy finance program offer financial strategy and risk management course which fit in the insudtry need  however  these two course are far from enough to help student understand the dynemic of industrial transformation and excitement and opportunity in this industry  other management and quantitive course are needed to complete this program  my suggestion    seminar or lecture about energy industry and energy company  before student make their decision  let them know  what  s happening and what  s going to happen in this industry  what the company are doing now  who they are looking for    management and  or analytical course should be included  such a  strategy  financial enginering and real option    more industry connection  presentation and discussion                                  from charlie weldon  mba class of   energy finance taken in fall of   my experience in the energy finance program overall wa a positive experience  the most rewarding part of the class wa the guest speaker brought in during dr  titman  s portion of the class  this part of the course is taught in the second half of the semester and consisted of   case class all focusing on the energy industry  two of the case were based on enron  and overall the case selection in my opinion wa very appropriate and well thought out  value added by the professor wa le than from the speaker and case  the first eight week of the course covered future and option  nearly all of the example and problem discussed pertained directly to the energy industry and special emphasis wa placed on increasing the student  s understanding of the supply and demand dynamic in the power market  the use of option and future for speculating and  or hedging wa stressed on numerous occasion and a decent attempt at explaining how to value a power plant project  i believe that the university energy finance faculty are trying to continuously make improvement to the program  however  i do not believe that they are moving fast enough or necessarily down the right path to improvement  there is a strong need for more practical based training on energy derivative similar to the course taught by paradigm here at enron  the focus of the university teacher is quite theoretical  due in large part to their background  while the theoretical basis is crucial to understanding the basic  the real value of such a program in my opinion is the effective bridging of the theoretical with the practical all in one course  until measure are taken to inject practicality from someone with extensive industry experience  i believe the energy finance program will continue to underdeliver on it objective  additionally  i believe that the course structure should be changed to eliminate the need of having  consecutive hour of classroom instruction

subject  california update      the following report contains confidential and sensitive information  please treat with discretion  executive summary   ferc price cap decision reflects bush political and economic objective  politically  bush is determined to let the crisis blame fall on davis  from an economic perspective  he is unwilling to create disincentive for new power generation  davis find four major flaw with ferc plan  most notably it exclusion of out  of  state generator  june lst  kill clause  for ferc order could coincide with new bush regional plan  california facing growing fiscal risk following bond downgrade  expected   billion power bill this summer   economic crisis would force deeper administration involvement  qf bid for advance payment from pg  e likely to fail in bankruptcy court  new generation delay probable because of state  qf squabbling  consumer group are preparing a constitutional challenge to socal bailout deal   ferc fallout the ferc decision is a holding move by the bush administration that look like action  but is not  rather  it allows the situation in california to continue to develop virtually unabated  the political strategy appears to allow the situation to deteriorate to the point where davis can not escape shouldering the blame  once they are politically inoculated  the administration can begin to look at regional solution  moreover  the administration ha already made explicit  and will certainly restate in the forthcoming cheney commission report  it opposition to stronger price cap on the ground that they are unwilling to create disincentive to the construction of new generation  it is interesting and ironic to note that electricity generator were generally happy with the ferc order and that the only ferc commissioner who favor price cap actually voted against this plan    something le than effective price cap from davis  s point of view  the ferc plan ha four major flaw   the order applies only to california  not to the rest of the west  non  california generator are not required to sell at capped rate to california   a the order is written  it is more of a price floor for emergency power than a ceiling   state official also believe that energy supplier will continue to game the system  because the price mitigation scheme only kick in after a stage  emergency and doe not require any collusion   even when the price cap kick in  they are based on the cost  plus for the highest cost producer supplying power to california and do not require wholesaler to abide by the cap  the generator can also charge above the cap  provided they can subsequently justify the excess charge to ferc    proposal  kill clause  add to the political dilemma for davis the ferc proposal includes a  kill clause  that say the cap will be withdrawn unless california  s iso agrees by june lst to become part of the regional grid now under ferc control  if davis doesn  t sign on to the regional grid by june lst  then he will have to live with june  nd headline blaming him for letting the  bush price cap plan  collapse    growing fiscal risk in california source speculate that california could therefore pay a much a   billion on power this summer  this is more than the combined enterprise value of pg  e and sce  these source believe that  because of the severity of the situation  the ferc and  or the federal government will be forced to take further action to control price for power  the consensus is that the state of california will run out of money in about  day  one of the first project to be cancelled will be state plan to finance new power plant construction in exchange for long  term power deal  the bleak fiscal picture is also causing bank creditor to revisit the bridge loan they are providing to california  the bush administration and the fed are only now waking up to the seriousness of the fiscal picture  the country  s largest and most prosperous state will have gone from large surplus to serious debt downgrade and devastating deficit in a matter of month    qfs to seek advance payment from pg  e meanwhile  on the bankruptcy front  the qfs reportedly will ask the bankruptcy judge today to give them advance payment from pge  s account  since their natural gas vendor have likewise demanded advance payment for gas  it appears very unlikely that the qfs  request will be granted  if the qfs do not receive advance payment  it is likely that most of the    mw of gas  fired qf capacity will remain offline   delay likely in new qf generation the qf deal made with the state for long  term contract are being continually renegotiated  which is likely to mean that the new plant those contract are supposed to finance will not be online a early a anticipated    consumer group ready to challenge constitutionality of sce bailout plan harvey rosenfield and his colleague reportedly have been reviewing an analysis of the mou for the sce bailout plan  the analysis wa done by a utility analyst  rather than a lawyer  though it appears to raise a number of good legal point  for example  one of the element of the mou is a  non  bypassable  charge on ratepayer that would require them to pay even if they disconnect from the grid  this is effectively a tax  since there is no exchange of value for money  which under the ca constitution can not be used to directly benefit a private entity  this make the bond that would be issued are general obligation bond  rather than revenue bond  according to the constitution  the state can not be put into debt to benefit a private company  for this and other reason  even if the republican would vote for the sce bailout  which remains unlikely  the bailout probably would not stand a likely constitutional challenge    governor hurt by continued failure to disclose long  term power contract the issue of the governor  s failure to disclose the detail of the long  term power contract continues to distress the other player in the crisis  even if he were to disclose everything he and his staff have been negotiating  it is likely that their action and negotiation will challenged  creating an even further delay

subject  fea announces the release of  energy    january    vince kaminski enron north america corp   smith street  th floor  rm   b houston  tx          dear vince kaminski  this is to inform you of the release of  energy     ftp download instruction are available immediately  the download instruction are included at the end of this email  your cd  s and manual will be shipped to you within  week  please see below for more information regarding this new release  please confirm that you are the correct recipient for this shipment and your address above is correct by clicking reply and send  if any change need to be made  please make the change above and reply    warning  please note that if you did not received a license key for  energy after june   you will need to contact support  fea  com or call      to obtain a new license key to enable the new version      swing user   energy  swing now replaces the  swing  product  see the  energy user manual for a discussion of the change  contact fea for the necessary license key  you will be able to run both the new and old swing simultaneously  here an overview of the new and changed feature since version      energy  forward curve  jump parameter are now calibrated for use in other  energy function  input and output to powercalib and comcalib have changed  see the corresponding function syntax in the user guide for additional information      speed improvement  the module is now out of beta   energy  basic  different interpolation scheme on forward price are now supported  if you use indexswap  exoticswap  or optindexswap with floating price linked to a series of future date  such future date need not be close to date specified in the forward curve input  a new utility function  pathutil  allows you to simulate and visualize price path consistent with the model supported by  energy      speed improvement   energy  advanced  different interpolation scheme on forward price are now supported  if you use optdiffswap or diffswap with floating price linked to a series of future date  such future date need not be close to date specified in the forward curve input  calspreadopt now allows for the specification of two different mean reversion rate      speed improvement   energy  swing  swingopt and stripswingopt now allow for valuation of swing straddle contract with overall load constraint      speed improvement  the module is now out of beta   energy  weather      speed improvement  if you have any question please feel free to contact u  we appreciate this opportunity to be of continuing service to enron subject  re  lng may  decision john  this is the update on what i have done for the lng transaction    i wa not involved in the lng ship project  i shall read the dash and give you my comment  without looking at the detail  i think that the decision to charter a tanker remove one significant risk we have at the elba island project  please  see point      elba island  i am working with doug rotenberbg  brad hitch  scott earnest  sally beck  s organization  and rac to set up the book for the elba island transaction  the next step will be to expand the book to capture all the enron  s lng  related position in one place and to look for natural risk offset and possible hedge  a working group is meeting to close a few remaining gap tomorrow  tuesday  at     a few comment on the book design and my view of the project  a  the current thinking is that lng will be sourced for the elba island facility by buying marginal cargo on the fob basis  marginal cargo will represent supply from excess capacity that ha not been committed under long  term contract or became available due to some short  term friction  the fob cargo are typically selling at a significant discount to the long  term contract price  the economics of the deal  a represented by the book we are setting up  will reflect the assumption that not only we can locate marginal cargo but that we shall be able to do it on a regular basis  arranging shipping and coordinating the facility schedule and natural gas transaction in the u  in other word  we have a significant logistical and operational risk in this transaction  b  the transaction will cover the period of  year  with an extension option of  year   even if we can lock  in the lng volume over this time period  we have no ability to lock  in the other side of the spread  u gas price  for such a long tenor  this is essentially a tolling transaction with exposure to the lng  nat gas spread and i would not recommend locking  in only one leg of the spread  one solution would be to cover  let  s say    of he lng volume for the first  year and lock  in the nat gas side on the u market side  c  the book we are setting up will be based on many managerial assumption regarding source of lng  shipping rate  schedule  etc  i would set up a big prudence reserve in case we mark it to market  d  my group will work on valuation of some option we have in the elba island deal  that are good for enron  and on the hedging strategy for the lng position  long  term lng contract are typically based on the japanese crude cocktail that correlate very well with brent  vince john sherriff         am to  vince j kaminski  hou  ect  ect cc  lauren urquhart  lon  ect  ect subject  lng may  decision vince i haven  t spoken to you for awhile but hope the world is treating you well  anyway with greg moving to his new role i have  i hope only temporarily  staff trading oversight for the eastern hemishere plus lng  i understand that your group is taking a first cut at developing curve for lng and lng ship value  i also understand that another lng ship decision is on the docket for may   not very far away   anway i understand this is a big decision but i still have gotten very little info yet  can you please let me know where you stand now  i will ask my assistant lauren to set up a time that i can speak with you in the next couple of day and if you have anything for me to review before then she can get it faxed to me a well  look forward to connecting with you vince  john

subject  latest draft don  attached is my latest effort  it entailed fairly drastic  restructuring and reorganization  of the earlier draft  my revision effort ha been directed at improving the focus of the paper  the new story is the following    enron wa formed a a regulated gas pipeline company in the mid  eighty    economic and competitive condition conspired to force a dramatic reorganization of the company almost immediately  the result wa the creation of a new  unregulated energy trading operation  the strategy of the new unit wa to capitalize on business opportunity in the deregulation of market that wa occuring at the time  mid  eighty until now     the business model adopted for the new unregulated business wa that of a  gas bank   the analogy to a commercial bank posed a very difficult problem to enron  s management in that there wa no source of liquidity to the market from a central bank authority  a a consequence enron had to develop it own very elaborate risk management procedure    another consequence of the new business model wa that it required a different set of employee skill and talent  specifically  it required were bright  energetic and innovative individual capable of identifying entrepreneurial opportunity and starting new business  furthermore  a new  flatter organizational structure entailing decentralized decision making wa required to facilitate quick response to changing market condition  to monitor and manage this new  empowered  labor force required that the firm develop new personnel policy and procedure    three primary tool of personnel management were adopted   i  measure performance semi  annually   ii  tie compensation closely to performance  and  iii  allow personnel free movement within enron to seek out the best opportunity    other attribute of the enron model include consideration for asset optionality  recognition of the value of network in adding value to trading platform  and the use of mark  to  market accounting for adopts other structural reform    at a special meeting friday afternoon  ferc unanimously approved it eagerly awaited final order reforming the california wholesale market  adopting the major outline of it november  proposed order and sending back to california the responsibility for addressing state  related matter  at the same time  ferc deferred consideration of retroactive refund issue a well a the imposition of region  wide price cap  ferc reiterated their earlier conclusion that under certain circumstance  california ratepayer were subjected to unjust and unreasonable power rate due to california  s  seriously flawed  market structure and rule in conjunction with tight demand and supply condition throughout the west  ferc adopted the november proposal to eliminate  effective immediately  the state  s mandatory requirement that the state  s investor  owned utility buy and sell electricity through the px  and allow these utility to purchase electricity through forward contract and other alternative mechanism to manage supply risk  ferc terminated the px  s rate schedule effective at the close of business on april     in effect  a chairman james hoecker stated  the order de  federalizes  percent of the california wholesale market established under the state  s restructuring law  returning ratemaking authority over company  owned generation to the california marketer to make power available to meet the state  s electricity need  the emergency directive requires that  if the california independent system operator  iso  certifies that there is an inadequate allocate the request in proportion to the amount of each supplier  s available power  the price for the power provided pursuant to the order will be set by an agreement between the iso and the december    statement and order  electric power daily  december     ferc de  federalizes california market  adopts other structural reform a summary of the december  order and commission discussion at it special meeting today  ferc unanimously approved it eagerly awaited final order reforming the california wholesale market  adopting the major outline of it november  proposed order and sending back to california the responsibility for addressing state  related matter  a discussed below  at the same time  ferc deferred consideration of retroactive refund issue a well a the imposition of region  wide price cap  ferc reiterated the november  conclusion that under certain circumstance  california ratepayer were subjected to unjust and unreasonable power rate due to california  s  seriously flawed  market structure and rule in conjunction with tight demand and supply condition throughout the west  while all four commissioner supported the order a a consensus  based outcome that appropriately balanced all competing interest  each commissioner expressed reservation with particular aspect of the order  chairman hoecker and comm  breathitt expressed the strongest endorsement  while comms  hebert and massey laid out their position where they believed the commission had either  over  reached  or not gone far enough  just a they did on november   a discussed below  highlight of key action     ferc adopted the november  proposal to eliminate  effective immediately  the state  s mandatory requirement that the state  s investor  owned utility buy and sell electricity through the px  and allow these utility to purchase electricity through forward contract and other alternative mechanism to manage supply risk  ferc terminated the px  s rate schedule effective at the close of business on april     in effect  a chairman hoecker stated  the order de  federalizes  percent of the california wholesale market established under the state  s restructuring law  returning ratemaking authority over company  owned generation to the california public utility commission  cpuc      ferc modified the effective period of the november     mwh  soft cap  proposal  limiting it application through april   whereupon a  comprehensive and systematic monitoring and mitigation program which incorporates appropriate threshold  screen and mitigation measure  must be in place  in a related move  ferc ordered a technical conference early next year to develop such a program by march     so that these measure can be place by the may   deadline  in a major modification  ferc revised the refund condition to clarify that while certain refund condition will continue to apply  unless ferc issue written notification to the seller that it transaction is still under review  refund potential on a transaction will close after  day  a proposed  however  supply bid in excess of   will be prohibited from setting the market  clearing price for all bidder and seller bidding above    mwh will be required to report their bid to ferc on a confidential  weekly basis and provide certain cost support     ferc adopted the november  proposal to require the establishment of independent  non  stakeholder governing board for the iso  the iso governing board must relinquish their decision  making power and operating control to the iso management on january     a future order will set procedure for discussion with state representative on the board selection process     in a major modification  ferc adopted a    mwh  price benchmark  for assessing price of five  year energy supply contract  this benchmark will be used in assessing any complaint regarding justness and reasonableness of pricing long  term contract  to facilitate prompt negotiation of longer term power contract at reasonable rate  ferc announced that it will hold a settlement conference with market participant     ferc adopted the november  proposal to require market participant to schedule  percent of their transaction in the day  ahead market and instituting a penalty charge for under  scheduling  in excess of five percent of hourly load requirement   in order to discourage over  reliance on the real  time spot market     ferc directed the iso and the three investor  owned utility to file generation interconnection standard     ferc affirmed the longer  term measure proposed in the november  order  including submission of a congestion management design proposal by april        ferc deferred resolving key issue  including establishing new iso board selection procedure  developing appropriate market monitoring measure and negotiating protective order associated with data collection     ferc reiterated it november  call to california policy maker there to resolve state issue  such a     immediately implementing the availability of day ahead market for power purchase     development of demand response     siting of generation and transmission  and    assurance of sufficient reserve requirement  commissioner response comm  hebert reluctantly concurred  calling the final order a  missed opportunity  to  among other thing  send appropriate signal for new generation siting and conservation  reiterating his november  concern  hebert recounted the remedial remedy that he maintained the commission should and should not have adopted  while expressing pleasure at the tone of the order   balanced and considerate    the bid certainly reversal  and the role reserved for the state in the selection of the new iso board  hebert nonetheless objected to the benchmark price established in the order  which he maintained appeared to be unreasonably low  hebert faulted the commission for not attempting to reconcile the instant order with the november  order approving the ca iso  s emergency    mwh  soft cap  proposal  hebert ended by challenging the cpuc to do what it can to encourage utility there to forward contract  including easing the existing prudence review requirement  comm  breathitt endorsed the order  reiterating her support for progress towards open and competitive market  she noted that the order properly  walked the line  by taking all of the competing interest into account  calling it le than ideal  but a step in the right direction  she also concentrated her remark on the importance of creating stability which will be accomplished by encouraging long term contract and the implementation of the    mwh breakpoint  additionally she mentioned that any price below the    mwh benchmark will be presumed just and reasonable  comm  massey concurred  but prefaced his remark by expressing sympathy for california ratepayer  stating that he felt that market power had been exercised  that price were not just and reasonable and that the marketer had profited too much at the expense of others in the market  he warned that  a he understood the legal precedent  the federal court were poised to grant cost recovery relief to the retailer which would then be passed on to consumer  on the positive side  he approved of the de  federalization of   of the market and the creation of long term contract  however  he emphasized that california regulator must now take the responsibility of creating more generation and transmission  in the long term  comm  massey hoped that solution could be reached starting with a technical conference and that the market would have rule more like pjm  finally  comm  massey articulated what he would have liked to have done differently  he stated that he disagreed with the fact that there is not enough evidence to show that market power existed and he pointed to the on  going investigation  he also disagreed with the    mwh breakpoint  preferring instead a hard price per generator  the commissioner said he would have set the long term benchmark for only two year instead of five and that he would have opened a section  investigation in the west  finally  he stated that he would have liked to address the issue of refund  chairman hoecker began his comment by saying that the commission wa forced to act and act quickly because the stake are so high  he feel that it is now time for the state regulator and market to act  he noted that by shrinking the cal px  the responsibility is now with the cpuc to fashion the long term contract and that hopefully we will exit this situation with the least amount of damage to the utility  in regard to suggestion for a regional price cap  the chairman stated that this would not work due to the fact that the commission ha no jurisdiction over bonneville  wapa and the public power producer and that there is no spot market in the northwest  however  he did urge secretary richardson to convene a conference in order to address regional issue  finally  in conceptually addressing the california situation  the chairman stated that competition or  deregulation  did not fail in california  but that there never wa competition in california

subject  organizational change we are making a number of significant organizational change  these change are intended to accomplish four key objective  first  we need to realign all our wholesale business around the successful business model developed over the last decade in north america and europe  this model relies on extensive physical and transactional network built around a relatively small strategic asset position  second  we need to significantly streamline corporate reporting relationship  particularly with joe sutton   s departure  the ability to directly manage the day  to  day activity of  independent business unit ha become increasingly difficult  third  we need to accomplish these change without  in any way  compromising the ongoing profitability of all our business and without delaying or hindering our effort to monetize a significant portion of our lower  yielding asset position  and fourth  a always  we need to take advantage of the reorganization to redeploy our talent into our highest value opportunity  enron wholesale service today  we are forming enron wholesale service  ew  which will consolidate our global wholesale business  the closer alignment of our wholesale business will accomplish the following     enhanced communication and coordination across business unit     more rapid deployment of people to higher valued opportunity     more effective prioritization of opportunity across the wholesale business  and    more rapid extension of enron   s wholesale business model and capability into new industry and market  enron wholesale service will include our current north american  european  including japan and australia   global market  and industrial market operation  and will be expanded to include enron   s net work business unit a well a a new unit   enron global asset  in addition  enron   s merchant business outside of north america and europe will be integrated into this new structure a described below  mark frevert  currently chairman of each of our wholesale unit  will assume the role of chairman and ceo of enron wholesale service  greg whalley  currently chairman and ceo of enron net work  will join mark in the office of the chairman a president and chief operating officer  providing further impetus for these organizational change  several of our international business unit leader have elected to move into new leadership position  rebecca mcdonald  currently ceo of enron apachi  will join ew a president and ceo of enron global asset  enron global asset will have responsibility for managing all of enron   s existing energy asset portfolio outside of north america and europe  joining rebecca in the office of the chairman a coo will be jim hughes  currently coo of enron apachi  rebecca and jim will report to the ew office of the chairman  sanjay bhatnagar  currently ceo of enron india  ha joined eb a ceo for the middle east and asia region  sanjay will be responsible for building our broadband business in this region and the current eb team in this region will report to sanjay  in this role  sanjay will report to the eb office of the chairman  in addition  sanjay will continue to remain responsible for enron   s wholesale energy business in india and will transition this business into enron global asset in the near future  diomedes christodoulou  currently co  ceo of enron south america  ha joined eb a chief commercial officer  diomedes will be located in london and will focus his origination activity on global opportunity  with near term attention to the wholesale and enterprise sector  diomedes will report to the eb office of the chairman  jim bannantine  currently co  ceo of enron south america  will be joining ee to lead ee   commercial effort outside north america and europe  in order to ensure a smooth transition for our south american business and to facilitate our asset sale activity  jim will remain in south america for at least the next several month and continue to serve a ceo of enron south america  throughout the transition  jim will report to cliff baxter and to the office of the chairman of enron wholesale service  following the transition  jim will join ee  in addition to these change in our international asset operation activity  we are making the following change in our merchant wholesale business and the commercial support function  enron net work louise kitchen will assume greg   s previous responsibility a president and ceo of enron net work  reporting into mark and greg  enron america concurrent with the transfer to enron global asset of responsibility for operating enron   s south and central america asset base  all trading  marketing  and new asset development activity in these region will report into a new entity  enron america  enron america will have responsibility for all wholesale merchant business across north  central and south america  dave delainey  president and ceo  and john lavorato  chief operating officer will comprise the office of the chairman for enron america  enron europe the enron europe organization  which includes enron   s business in australia and japan  and enron metal  remains unchanged under the leadership of john sherriff  president and ceo  and michael brown  chief operating officer  enron global market enron global market  under the leadership of mike mcconnell  president and ceo  and jeff shankman  chief operating officer  will continue to have responsibility for enron   s middle east and lng operation  with the exception of ecoelectrica in puerto rico  all operating power plant and associated personnel in the caribbean and central america will transfer to enron global asset  enron global market will also continue to manage the commodity business in crude and product  coal  weather  insurance  equity  interest rate  foreign exchange  and agricultural product  enron industrial market enron industrial market   organization  under the leadership of jeff mcmahon  president  ceo  and ray bowen  chief operating officer  remains unchanged  commercial support for ew the commercial support function for ew will remain with  and be managed by  the individual business unit  we are creating no incremental overhead in the creation of ew  and in fact hope to reduce our operating cost by more efficient utilization and sharing of resource across ew  to this end we have asked several people to take on an expanded role across ew in addition to their ongoing role within their business unit  these newly defined role are a follows  mid and back office operation   sally beck will lead mid and back office operation across ew  these service will become part of enron net work  with sally reporting to louise kitchen and rick causey  executive vice president and chief accounting officer  this alignment creates a coordinated service organization with it and e  commerce platform to support the wholesale business and to maximize these individual will also continue to have a split reporting relationship to mark palmer  vice president of communication  business analysis and reporting   wes colwell will expand his role to cover  committee structure in light of the increased leadership opportunity created by enron   s growth  the executive committee will be expanded to include more of our business unit leader  the primary leave previous year  s total asset blank for australian company  current liability liability are positive value  included in current liability are short  term debt  account payable  and other current liability  total liability this balance sheet account  total liability  is a positive number representing the sum of current liability plus long  term debt plus other noncurrent liability  including deferred tax  investment tax credit  and minority interest   retained earnings retained earnings  a historical measure of performance  is the cumulative earnings of the company le total dividend distribution to shareholder  typically  it is the prior year  s retained earnings plus net income le distribution  retained earnings are generally positive  some firm with low credit quality will have negative retained earnings  leave this field blank for australian company  sale this item consists of the industry segment  s gross sale  the amount of actual billing to customer for regular sale completed during the period  reduced by cash discount  trade discount  and returned sale and allowance for which credit is given to customer  cost of good sold entered in thousand of dollar  this value is generally a positive number le than sale  it represents all cost directly allocated by the company to production  such a material  labor  and overhead  not fixed overhead or item that would be included in selling  general  and administrative expense  leave this field blank for australian company  ebit earning before interest expense is operating income after depreciation  it can be positive or negative but is usually greater then net income  interest expense this item represents the periodic expense to the company of securing short  and long  term debt  typically  we expect this charge to be approximately the prevailing interest rate time the total liability  one measure of computing this is  interest expense      total liability  net income this item represents the income  or loss  reported by a company after expense and loss have been subtracted from all revenue and gain for the fiscal period including extraordinary item and discontinued operation  a loss is represented by a negative sign  for example  a       loss would be entered a    leave previous year  s net income blank for australian company  extraordinary item positive or negative  this item represents unusual item that sometimes appear on the income statement  the item are designated by the company a extraordinary and presented after net income from continuing operation and discontinued operation  these item include extraordinary gain  loss  income  loss  from discontinued operation  and cumulative affect of accounting change  expense are entered a negative value  gain a positive value  leave previous year  s extraordinary item blank for australian company  country this model is calibrated for the united state  canada  and australia  we look forward to receiving this information for enron  s private firm north american counterparties so that we can move on to the next step with the evaluation of riskcalc  thanks  iris
