subject  japanese power market another article i thought you might find interesting  regard  eugenio review of energy policy kick off asahi shimbun april    a government advisory panel on monday embarked on a comprehensive review of energy  related policy    we want to come up with feasible policy and at the same time clearly present reason for those policy    yoichi kaya  a professor emeritus at the university of tokyo  told a meeting of the coordination subcommittee under the advisory committee for energy  an advisory panel to minister of international trade and industry takashi fukaya  kaya chair the subcommittee  the nuclear development policy  including the government  s goal for building new nuclear power plant  is expected to be a focus of the discussion  a spate of nuclear accident have made construction of plant increasingly difficult  and the nation  s power supplier have reduced the number of new nuclear power plant expected to be in operation by fiscal  from  to   the subcommittee  set up for the first time in about  year  is made up of about  member  and member of anti  nuclear nongovernmental organization have been included for the first time  some member told monday  s meeting that the government must stop taking the nuclear development policy for granted and seriously look into the possibility of introducing renewable energy  such a wind and solar power  also on the agenda will be energy saving measure  energy consumption in the residential and commercial sector  made up of home and office  and in the transportation sector  which includes car and truck  ha almost doubled over the past  year  at monday  s meeting  many member stressed the need to change public consciousness toward the use of energy  miti plan to present study on how life would be affected by compulsory energy saving measure such a automatically turning off air conditioner at certain temperature or vehicle engine when they are idle

subject  re  preface for book julie  the introduction look fine  i have made some cosmetic change  typo and split infinitive that slipped by   you can safely ignore most of them  english is not even my second language  the correction are in pink  vince  julie  on           am to   vincejkaminski  cc  subject  preface for book vince   hope you are well   we spoke a while ago about who should write the preface for the book  and you kindly offered that you would provide this   is this still possible   we realise that you are extremely busy  so chris and le went ahead and wrote something  which is below  and if you want to review  change or re  write  the preface  that would be very appreciated   let me know what your thought are   thanks  julie  we  re getting close    preface    one of our main objective in writing energy derivative  pricing and risk management ha been to bring together a many of the various approach for the pricing and risk management energy derivative a possible  to discus in  depth the model  and to show how they relate to each other   in this way we hope to help the reader to analyse the different model  price a wide range of energy derivative  or to build a risk management system which us a consistent modelling framework   we believe that for practitioner this last point is very important and we continue to stress in our article and presentation the danger of having flawed risk management and giving arbitrage opportunity to your competitor by using ad  hoc and inconsistent model for different instrument and market  see also others who propose consistent model     however  it is not our wish to concentrate on one particular model or model  at the exclusion of the others because we believe that the choice should rest with the user  although it will probably be clear from our discussion the model  s  we prefer    we therefore try and give a clear account a possible of the advantage and disadvantage of all the model so that the reader can make an informed choice a to the model which best suit their need   in order to meet our objective the book is divided into  chapter   in chapter  we give an overview of the fundamental principal needed to model and price energy derivative which will underpin the remainder of the book   in addition to introducing the technique that underlie the black  scholes modelling framework we outline the numerical technique of trinomial tree and monte carlo simulation for derivative pricing  which are used throughout the book   in chapter  we discus the analysis of spot energy price   a well a analysing empirical price movement we propose a number of process that can be used to model the price   we look at the well  know process of geometric brownian motion a well a mean reversion  stochastic volatility and jump process  discussing each and showing how they can be simulated and their parameter estimated   chapter   written by vince kaminski  grant masson and ronnie chahal of enron corp   discus volatility estimation in energy commodity market   this chapter build on the previous one   it examines in detail the method  merit and pitfall of the volatility estimation process assuming different pricing model introduced in chapter    example from crude  gas  and electricity market are used to illustrate the technical and interpretative aspect of calculating volatility   chapter  examines forward curve in the energy market   although such curve are well understood and straight  forward in the most financial market  the difficulty of storage in many energy market lead to le well defined curve   in this chapter we describe forward price bound for energy price and the building of forward curve from market instrument   we outline the three main approach which have been applied to building forward curve in energy market  the arbitrage approach  the econometric approach  and deriving analytical value by modelling underlying stochastic factor   chapter  present an overview of structure found in the energy derivative market and discus their us   example of product analysed in this chapter include a variety of swap  cap  floor and collar  a well a energy swaptions  compound option  asian option  barrier option  lookback option  and ladder option   chapter  investigates single and multi  factor model of the energy spot price and the pricing of some standard energy derivative   closed form solution for forward price  forward volatility  and european option price both on the spot and forward are derived and presented for all the model in this chapter including a three factor  stochastic convenience yield and interest rate model   chapter  show how the price of path dependent and american style option can be evaluated for the model in chapter    simulation scheme are developed for the evaluation of european style option and applied to a variety of path dependent option   in order to price option which incorporate early exercise opportunity  a trinomial tree scheme is developed   this tree is built to be consistent with the observed forward curve and can be used to price exotic a well a standard european and american style option   chapter  describes a methodology for valuing energy option based on modelling the whole of the market observed forward curve   the approach result in a multi  factor model that is able to realistically capture the evolution of a wide range of energy forward curve   the user defined volatility structure can be of an extremely general form   closed  form solution are developed for pricing standard european option  and efficient monte carlo scheme are presented for pricing exotic option   the chapter close with a discussion of the valuation of american style option   chapter  focus on the risk management of energy derivative position   in this chapter we discus the management of price risk for institution that trade option or other derivative and who are then faced with the problem of managing the risk through time   we begin with delta hedging a portfolio containing derivative and look at extension to gamma hedging   illustrating the technique using both spot and forward curve model   the general model presented in chapter  is ideally suited to multi  factor hedging of a portfolio of energy derivative and this is also discussed   chapter  examines the key risk management concept of value at risk  var  applied to portfolio containing energy derivative product   after discussing the concept of the measure  we look at how the key input  volatility  covariance  correlation  etc  can be estimated   we then compare the four major methodology for computing var  delta  delta  gamma  historical simulation and monte  carlo simulation  applying each to the same portfolio of energy option   in this chapter we also look at testing the var estimate for various underlying energy market variable   finally  in chapter  we review modelling approach to credit risk   we look in detail at two quite different approach  creditmetrics  j  p  morgan     and creditrisk   credit suisse financial product     for which detailed information is publicly available   together these provide an extensive set of tool with which to measure credit risk   we present numerical example of applying these technique to energy derivative   before we begin we stress that the model and method we present in this book are tool which should be used with the benefit of an understanding of how both the   tool   and the market work   the technique we describe are certainly not   magic wand   which can be waved at data and risk management problem to provide instant and perfect solution   to quote from the riskmetrics technical document     no amount of sophisticated analytics will replace experience and professional judgement in managing risk      however  the right tool  correctly used make the job a lot easier

subject  precious metal var jason  after our brief discussion last night i think i should discus a few of the issue i have with respect to calculating a var on the deal that you are proposing  the var model  a i illustrated  is set up to accept a term structure of delta position  price and vols and it may be difficult to translate the  silver mine  position into these input  i do not think that we can simply take the net silver content of the mine and then make some assumption about vol and price  the var model also assumes a certain amount of liquidity in the market and a  day holding period  to do this properly i would need to understand fully how the deal is priced a these sensitivity are ultimately what will effect the change in mtm in the future and that is essentially what var is supposed to predict  if you need me to work on this then you need to contact steve who will help to prioritise my time  i will also need to consult with vince kaminski and tanya tamarachenko in houston for advice  rac will also assist in the process  please contact me if you have any further question  kirstee x

may know  i wa invited to visit with enron  ene  last week  i met with vince kaminski  the vp and head of research in the risk management group of ene  vince who used to be with salomon brother and at  t is the  brain  of ene w  r  t  their analytical tool for pricing of commodity  hedging  optimization of financial and physical transaction  a well a the value  at  risk system  in addition  vince entitled  managing energy price risk  our meeting wa mainly focused on gaining additional insight re leading  edge practice within ene  my key finding are summarized below    ene doe not use corporate price premise  they use market price info only and adhere to mark  to  market accounting    ene us the  heath  jarrow  and morton  method for modeling price dynamic  i  ve asked bic for a copy of the associated paper   they have their own  home  grown  software  however  they periodically review selected external development for internal inclusion and advancement    vince  s group comprises of and bus across ene    investment proposal are screened  risked  and  roved  by a separate corporate group  similar to our special study and with business and real option skill  who work in conjunction with the bus  all evaluation and transaction are marked  to  market    ene doe not use efficient  frontier portfolio concept  they  vc fund  any opportunity that ha a credible value proposition and can stand on it own  they believe that with the current plentiful liquidity in the market  project  financing in not an issue for a  good  opportunity  however  they closely monitor the development of each opportunity  within their deep portfolio  at the corporate level and know how to  fail fast     the employee reward system is based on p  l a well a the creation of new business    most employee subject  enron europe organisational change once the arcos plant in spain is financially closed  expected in q  of this year  eric gonzales will be moving back to houston to work exclusively on co  managing enron  s lng market  we are very appreciative of eric  s effort in europe since early  and look forward to continuing to work very closely with his lng team in the coming year  from this point forward eric will focus his remaining time in europe exclusively on financially closing arcos  we are therefore making the following change immediately  the origination responsibility for italy will be moved under eric shaw  ricardo bortolloti will continue in the role a italian country manager and will report to eric shaw  mariano gentilini will become our country manager for spain and portugal and will report directly to the enron europe office of the chairman  the arcos power project is likely to create a large gas to power spread position and so we have asked paul mead to assume the added responsibility for our natural gas risk position in spain  this position is much more likely to be supplied and influenced by lng rather than continental gas market and paul will work quite closely with both enron global market and the continental gas team  ross sankey who ha been managing our marketing effort in holland will also head a new organization that will focus on subsea interconnector and power transmission opportunity across europe  among the prospect his team will pursue include project from norway to the uk  sweden to the continent  and bidding on existing french interconnector capacity  he will report to eric shaw for the holland market and to richard lewis for the transmission responsibility  finally the continental gas team is interacting far more with our uk gas team than our power team on the continent  therefore david galagher who manages our continental gas team will now report directly to richard lewis  we have aggressive income target for this year and anticipate that these change will create the right link to optimize our performance  please help make these change a smooth a possible  john sherriff michael brown

subject  from the enron india newsdesk  jan  th newsclips vince  fyi                        forwarded by sandeep kohli  enron _ development on         pm                            from the enron india newsdesk  jan  th newsclips untie them  editorial  thursday jan    http    www  economictimes  com  today   edito   htm        state not to give tax sop to dpc for buying naphtha from ioc   sanjay jog  thursday jan         centre yet to receive proposal on enron thursday jan    http    www  economictimes  com  today   infro   htm        untie them  editorial  thursday jan   the government of maharashtra want new delhi to convince the power trading corporation  a central utility  to buy power from dabhol and sell it across the country  it would be far simpler if dabhol and all independent power producer were allowed to sell power to whoever wa willing to pay for it  that  unfortunately  is not allowed by law  which force private sector generator to sell power only to state utility  which in turn  are not permitted to sell power across state on their own  most state electricity board are bankrupt  mseb reportedly owes central utility r    crore  they can not bring themselves to charge many type of user for the power consumed  nor can they prevent large  scale theft of electricity  few  including wealthy maharashtra  have the will to reform state electricity board and privatise transmission and distribution  given this profile of buyer  private generator demand sovereign guarantee to help them tide over default risk  but the guarantee merely insulate ipps against risk  they can not make seb solvent  yet  india need power desperately  maharashtra  india   s richest state  experience power shortage of around    mw  about a sixth of it peak need  over time  the hunger for power will only grow  india can not afford to wait for the painful politics of seb reform to work themselves out  the government should bring in legislation that allows ipps to sell power directly to paying customer  this will free ipps from the clutch of bankrupt monopsony buyer  the power trading legislation will have unexpectedly happy consequence for the government too  once ipps are freed from their onerous obligation to sell power to single  mostly bankrupt buyer  their default risk will come down substantially  new delhi and state government should then scrap the guarantee that they gave ipps in the past  the combination of power trading  private investment in generation  transmission and distribution  and gradual seb reform will create a commercial  workable and competitive power market in india  anything le will be a recipe for disaster         state not to give tax sop to dpc for buying naphtha from ioc   sanjay jog  thursday jan   the maharshtra government  s finance department  which is striving to reduce fiscal deficit from r    crore to r    crore by the beginning of april this year  ha expressed it inability to provide a sale tax waiver to the dabhol power company  dpc  on the procurement of    million tonne of naphtha from the state  run indian oil corporation  ioc   mantralaya source told the financial express on wednesday that dpc would have to pay  per cent sale tax   the government  way back in   ha modified the sale tax rate to  per cent to discourage the import of naphtha from gujarat by electrical company operating in maharashtra  the decision wa taken with a view to encouraging electrical company to procure naphtha at reduced rate within the state   government source added  source said that these company had to pay nearly    per cent sale tax on naphtha that wa procured from gujarat  however  following their representation  the government slashed the sale tax rate to  per cent  the state finance department  s opinion  which would be presented before the state cabinet shortly in order to take a final decision  deserves special significance especially when the state energy department and the loss  making maharashtra state electricity board  mseb  have wholeheartedly supported the dpc  s cause and recommended the sale tax waiver  dpc  which wa asked by the union ministry of oil and petroleum to procure naphtha within the country in view of excess availability  in it presentation to the state government and to mseb  had made it clear that it would be left with no alternative but to pas on the additional burden on the mseb which would be ultimately passed on to it consumer  dpc had also told the state government that it had not paid sale tax on the procurement of naphtha from glencore in the calender year   source from the state energy department and mseb have stressed on the need for such a waiver while expressing their inability to bear additional burden  they have suggested that the state should reciprocate by offering a sale tax exemption to dpc because the ioc  at the behest of the centre  ha tried to match the international landing price of naphtha during the recently signed memorandum of agreement with dpc   if the state finance department stick to it view  it may hurt the state a a whole   source from the state energy department and mseb said  dpc will procure naphtha at r    per ton from ioc during the calender year  a compared to the r    per tonne price quoted by glencore  the naphtha price comprises   per tonne free on board  fob      per cent of custom duty     per cent of sale tax and     of premium  dpc senior vice president mukesh tyagi reiterated that the company ha already made an appeal to the state government for the sale tax waiver on naphtha in the larger interest of the consumer   sale tax is a pas through and mseb  which will have to bear the additional burden  will pas it on the consumer   he added         centre yet to receive proposal on enron thursday jan   centre on wednesday said that it had not recevied any proposal from maharashtra government seeking help to solve the tangle with the enron promoted dhabol power project relating to cost and surplus power  asked about the report that maharashtra government wa sending a proposal that centre buy surplus power from dhabol power company through power trading corporation  power minister suresh prabhu said  we have not received any proposal    we are carefully watching the situation and will await a concrete proposal before intervening in this matter   parbhu said on the sideline of greentech environment excellence award ceremony  here  asked whether there wa any possibility of the government asking the power trading corporation to buy power from the dhabol power corporation  prabhu replied  what will the ptc do with the power   prabhu had earlier asked the state government to study the matter before approaching the centre for payment of due  mseb had earlier declined to pick up it  per cent stake in phase ii of the  mw project  the enron issue ha been hanging fire with the maharashtra state electricity board unable to clear the due of dpc a a result of the skyrocketing price of naphtha infact mseb ha asked dpc to backdown completely leading to a situation where dpc ha stopped production at the facility from the begining of the month  state government ha stepped in with support to the tune of r  crore to enable mseb to clear the due for october  mseb due to dpc for november and december amount to over r  crore

technology track is part of the analyst and associate program  we will not be participating in the super saturday event listed below  technologist candidate will be brought into the office for a friday office visit  super saturday were first initiated for commercial analyst and associate recruiting because many enron representative were not able to leave their desk while the market wa open during the workday  bringing candidate in during the weekend work well in this situation because enron representative can fully participate in the office visit and candidate can still see the office  however  many technology vps have suggested that seeing enron  alive and in action  during the week would be a high selling point for technologist candidate  therefore  we have opted to have technology office visit on friday  the first three office visit are listed below  november  th december lst january  th we will be sending out more detailed information on how you can become more subject  abstract shmuel  this is the abstract for my presentation on the  rd of october  i am in london and paris this week  i can be reached at my private e  mail address vkaminski  aol  com  please  feel free to suggest modification to the abstract  vince  the last three year were characterized by exceptionally high volatility of  the power price in the u market  the market development have created a  number of unique challenge for energy industry economist  one immediate  question we have to answer is how to measure volatility of energy price   although we can all agree that the price in the power market are  characterized by high variability  the traditional measure used in financial  economics  annualized standard deviation of log price return  may not fit  well electricity price  the second challenge is to explain the source of  high price volatility and to answer the question to what extent it can be  attributed to problem that can be addressed in the long run  such problem  include flaw in market design that allow some market participant to abuse  market power  limited availability and  or unequal access to transmission   temporary shortage of generation capacity  some factor underlying high  volatility of electricity price may be of permanent nature and may be a  necessary price to pay for increased market efficiency and expanded customer  choice

subject  vince and vasant  here is a brief summary of my meeting with chris germany  capacity trader at the east desk  related to gas transmission  typically  pipeline lease capacity billed on a monthly basis  an example might be the pipeline between south texas and brooklyn  where you might pay     per month per    decatherms of capacity      per day   a fixed payment  variable charge are   for fuel cost   shrinkage   and     for overhead expense  a gas trader might call south texas and be quoted a delivery price tomorrow of nymex        basis    and might call brooklyn and be quoted a delivered price of nymex       the trader  s spread is      and variable cost of transmission are      so the trader would offer the leaseholder of capacity up to     for firm capacity tomorrow  a for the distinction betweem firm and interruptible  the leaseholder have an excellent knowledge of the firm  equivalent of interruptible capacity  also  many pipeline don  t discount firm capacity from the tariff maximum   it  s not worth their time to haggle    there is a further issue of  secondary market  not important to the model yet   for south texas and brooklyn  there are several different route the gas can physically take  pipeline of enron  texas eastern  etc   and  once the trade is in the system trader can cover the  enron  position on each end of the pipeline  in so doing freeing up the capacity for other contract  clayton

subject  re  equity investment fair value in turkey john  it seems to me that using a risk  free rate is not appropriate  i shall elaborate on my position and send you a longer message this afternoon  my time   vince enron capital  trade resource corp   europe from  john bottomley         am to  vince j kaminski  hou  ect  ect cc  john sherriff  lon  ect  ect  dale surbey  lon  ect  ect subject  equity investment fair value in turkey vince  john sherriff recommended that i contact you regarding an interesting  and potentially contentious  option valuation issue we are currently dealing with in london  we hold longish term option in a private company in turkey which is currently seeking to ipo  the issue we are discussing with rac is which discount rate  i  e   risk  free  and if so turkish or u   should we use to value these option first  some additional information  option characteristic       option  representing   of the company    term  minimum of  year but possibly longer   still being renegotiated   strike price    below the upcoming ipo price  either priced in u  or turkish lira  we currently hold the above number of option with a fixed price of     per option but    expire on july    with the remainder expiring on december     the company  s investment banker  abn  amro rothchilds  are concerned regarding the strike price because it value the company at   million and they believe the company is worth approx   million  due to such a large  valuation gap   they originally encouraged u to exercise all of the option by the end of june  ipo target date in late sept  early oct   our counter  proposal is to  swap  instrinsic value for time value by repricing the option strike higher while extending their term  we are currently negotiating with rac the most appropriate discount rate to use to value the option  we are arguing that the u risk free is the most appropriate discount rate and their current position is that the company  s historical senior debt cost     is the more appropriate number to use  although admit that this is not justifiable   only a proxy  a few key point    rac is valuing the option via crystal ball simulation such that this  to be negotiated  discount rate is used to calculate the pv of the future option intrinsic value in  year  i  e   for black  scholes  a higher discount rate yield a higher value but the opposite is true using crystal ball simulation    the model simulates both an ipo  no ipo case and in the case of no ipo we have put option for our equity priced at a fixed   return   the model assigns a   illiquidity discount   in the simulated case where the option are out  of  the  money  we obviously do not exercise  we understand that for black  scholes option valuation  one need to be able to construct a comparable portfolio of cash flow using equity future and the risk free in order for the valuation to hold  and here is where we reach our difficulty  since the company doesn  t currently trade on a public market and since equity future do not exist for turkish equity  rac is arguing that a u risk free is not appropriate to use  our argument is that the non  ipo scenario  a   illiquidity discount and a u  based option volatility are already in the factored into the simulation  a such  we feel rac  s approach is double counting  if you managed to get through the above  your a patient man  i  ll give you a call today or tomorrow after you  ve had a chance to digest the information  regard  john bottomley

subject  sap timesheets hello everyone  thanks to krishna we have come up with a plan that i believe is going to save everyone some time  we have created an excel spreadsheet  with the time sheet form  and there is a tab for each of you  in alphabetical order by first name across the bottom of the spreadsheet  the spreadsheet is saved in o   research  common  sap timesheets  mmm  dd   mmm  month and dd   th or end of the month time period  i  e   this time period is            the regular  hour day have already been entered for each of you  therefore  if you have no exception you just need to type in your name in the bottom right corner by the place marked  emp sign   and save it  if you do have exception time  simply open that particular pay period and show the exception time  off  duty  vacation  overtime  sick time  jury time  family time  etc   that you may have had during that pay period  some of the code have already been entered for you  the rest are listed at the bottom of the spreadsheet and just change the one that are already there for whatever applies  if you are an exempt employee you need only show your off  duty time or exception time  if you are non  exempt you must show all hour worked and if you have overtime  you must add that to the  hour regular time  there is no code for non  exempt overtime  this should make it much easier for everyone  however  i will need you to fill out this timesheet form by the  th and  th of each month  i will try and remind you by email the day before  i would still appreciate your emailing me of any vacation  hod day  or any other off  duty that you know about before hand  that way if you are out of pocket for any reason and can not fill in one of the form  i will be able to fill in your timesheet for you  if you have any question or suggestion  please let me know  thanks  shirley

here is the information that i have on paulo  he would be slated to work for the summer with april hodgeson and matt harris on how streaming medium product may add value to advertising or some related area  actually  he would also be a good fit for helping to think way to analyze our enron on  line data  i have asked if he can send a resume  in the mean time  most of his relevant information is attached below    stinson                       forwarded by stinson gibner  hou  ect on         am                            paulo rocha e oliveira on           pm to   stinson gibner  cc  subject  re  trip to houston stinson  thank you for your e  mail  my phone number is        i graduated from princeton university in   mathematics   and came straight to mit for a ph  d  in operation management at the sloan schoolof management  in my first three year i took all the required coursework in mathematics  optimization  stochastic process  etc   a well a a number of course in psychology  at mit and harvard   i am working with prof  gabriel bitran  and i am interested in the mathematical modeling of service operation  in particular  i am interested in the interaction between customer and company  hence the interest in psychology   the  tentative  title of my phd thesis is  pricing substitute product on the internet   and i am sending you the summary which i sent to tom gros a few week ago that will give you an idea of what this research is about  thanks again  and i  m looking forward to meeting you and your research group next week  paulo pricing substitute product on the internet objective  to develop new tool to decide pricing policy for good and service sold on the internet  motivation  this research is motivated by the fact that traditional choice and optimization model are not appropriate for internet  related business  the technological innovation associated with the internet brought about an overload of information which inevitably affect the way in which consumer make choice  furthermore  company have a great deal of influence on how much information consumer can have access to  the problem of pricing substitute product is an important strategic issue faced by internet company  consumer usually search for generic product  e  g  vcr or computer  without knowing exactly what they will buy  company can show different product and different price to each consumer  this type of flexibility wa not available until the internet came about  the problem of pricing substitute product is not unique to the internet  the methodology developed by this research should be transferable to a number of other setting  such a pricing service  service are unique  and there are many case where customer will only buy one of many service offered by a given company  our model will help company decide which service to offer to which customer and how much to charge for these service  research strategy  our research strategy is to divide the pricing problem into two component which can be combined to generate optimal pricing strategy  these component are choice model and optimization model  choice model  choice model describe how customer make choice  the management literature draw on two main source for these model  psychology and economics  the common approach in psychology model is to use what are called heuristic elimination method  these method consist of the elimination of option based on the sequential elimination of feature until only one choice remains  these method tend to be very context  specific and do not lend themselves very easily to mathematical analysis  economist focus on utility  maximing model that are significantly more mathematically tractable than psychological model  the most common economic model of choice is the logit model  the problem with these type of model is that they are not very accurate reflection of how consumer make choice on the internet  the first step in our research will be to develop choice model that capture the interaction going on between customer and company on the internet  optimization  traditionally  the optimization problem consists of maximizing revenue over a certain planning horizon  on the internet  the problem of maximizing revenue still exists  but there is also a need to learn about customer  short term profit is based on sale  but long term profit is based on how well you know your customer and are able to retain them  the optimization problem must therefore include a short term component  sale  and a long term component  learning

subject  energy leader consulting generation evaluator  ege  shirley  a requested  herein is information regarding the meeting with vince kaminski  the presentation on the ege tool  s application and the allegheny energy case study is timed to take an hour  if the meeting is most conveniently scheduled for tuesday  may   might i request it be set for late afternoon  a my other appointment are the next day   and  a vince will recall  i wa co  leader of the energy consulting business of phb hagler bailly  and developer of the ramp up  real time   check and electric strategy tool  presently  i am ceo of energy leader consulting  elc   background the u  s  power generation industry ha become increasingly efficient in recent year  rapidly growing new entrant seek profit maximization aggressively  utility  who still control most power plant  endeavor to adopt the entrant  method  yet  inefficiency among many utility remains widespread  utility inefficiency arises from adherence to decade  old habit and in unit commitment and dispatch and planned maintenance scheduling  many utility  notwithstanding the industry  wide trend towards profit maximization  cling to ingrained routine  inefficiency can also arise from the diseconomies of small scale  a utility may operate a relatively small system  fewer than a dozen plant   a small system lack portfolio diversification and perspective in it focus on it regulated customer  playing the wholesale market at the margin  for a variety of reason  utility are reluctant to cut back the start of their generating unit  let alone shut down any  even temporarily or seasonally   economically inefficient unit continue to be committed  week after week  and run in the half  load range  ege objective ege identifies and ass generating unit of a utility with questionable commitment routine  taking into account transmission and reliability factor  the procedure point towards profit opportunity that may be exploited by another industry participant  i  an industry participant can use ege a a basis for a medium or long  term wholesale power transaction with a utility  or to price wholesale power more aggressively  to take market share from the utility  i  e   compel change in unit commitment habit   ii  an industry participant can use ege to spot and quantify efficiency that would come from a merger or acquisition  iii  a power plant developer can use ege to estimate the incremental value a new plant will enjoy when the target utility  s unit commitment routine inevitably become rationalized  specific ege concept ege reduces and analysis the extraordinary but unwieldy continuous emission monitoring data base intelligently focusing on profit opportunity  it produce indicative statistic such a  a  the frequency distribution of start per week  b  the frequency distribution of start by day    minute segment during the week  c  the frequency distribution of load level  d  the frequency distribution of hour of operation per start  e  average heat rate and approximate fully  allocated cost in the half  load range  f  average ramp rate from the half  load range  g  the frequency distribution of unused connected capacity during the highest demand hour  and h  forced  off maintenance outage rate  where indicated   indicative statistic are generally aggregated by month  year  in some case  by temperature range   they can be by regional wholesale price a well   ege establishes if the target utility ha changed unit commitment routine significantly in recent year  ege is based upon uniquely timely actual hourly operating data  ege is now updated for the  th quarter   through december      ege lst quarter   through march     will be available approximately june     ege also compare and rank generating unit  commitment and dispatch with that of similar unit operated by the target utility  a well a other regional generator   some utility operate a group of economically marginal unit at the half  load level for lengthy time period  without an apparent reliability basis   splitting the limited economic demand for power among the unit  other ege supporting data  i  planned maintenance schedule  where indicated   j  actual maximum generating capacity  k  actual minimum generating capacity  actual maximum and minimum can differ significantly from government  reported value   l  average heat rate in the full  load range  and m  average heat rate in the three  quarter  load range  with respect to a generating unit  average heat rate in the half  load  three  quarter  load and full  load range  it can be instructive to rank these relative to similar generating unit within a region  it can also be of interest to identify significant seasonal variation in average heat rate and maximum capacity  and change in recent year in these parameter  the real  world example of allegheny energy allegheny energy can serve a a case study to illustrate the application of ege  in the  th quarter   for instance  one high  cost generating unit wa started virtually every weekday morning   time  and committed for the whole day  in all but two case   arguably  there are power product that could substitute for this routine  in part at least  at a profit to the seller of the product and allegheny energy  another high  cost allegheny energy generating unit wa started virtually every weekend during the autumn  nine time  and committed for most of the coming week  at another plant  two high  cost unit were operated too often in the expensive half  load range  some  hour  and three  quarter  load range  another  to  hour   they were seldom called upon to run at higher level  again  there are power product that that address these practice and might appeal to allegheny energy  offering of energy leader consulting  elc  ege is a procedure  not a software package or data base  elc belief this format is more effective in arming client with the information they need to act upon profit opportunity  elc transfer it  knowledge  about the ege procedure and the supporting data method in a straight  forward four  step process    enron would select one to three target utility    elc would perform the ege procedure on the target utility    employing this real  world analysis a a pedagogic tool  elc  in a one  day seminar with enron personnel  would instruct how to perform the procedure in the future  without the assistance of elc     optionally  elc would provide ege supporting data  quarterly  to enron  the basic ege supporting data set is national including all generating unit under the continuous emission monitoring program  virtually all fossil fuel unit   parameter that are incorporated  and the data set format  will be specified upon request  custom modification will be considered  steven a  mitnick chief executive officer energy leader consulting   st street  nw washington  dc        voice       fax smitnick  energyleader  com

subject  re  stressing correlation hi  everybody  following up on our discussion on stressing correlation i made a spreadsheet and a dll  here is what it doe  in the input   main  sheet  the user ha to specify   the size of the correlation matrix   the row and column for the element he want to stress  row   and col   in the example   the integer number n _ iter   the original correlation matrix  in the output  see sheet  result   we see  column   the first column contains possible correlation value  from   to   n _ iter   number  for the element        the second column contains the smallest eigenvalue for the  stressed  correlation matrix  which is the same a the original matrix except the element      and      which take value from   to    thus  the user can see which value for the chosen element      are permitted  those for which the smallest eigenvalue is positive  marked green in the example   the user might decide that he want to assign the correlation which is  not permitted  to this particular element  the smallest eigenvalue is negative   then the user might have a few option    all the element of the correlation matrix will be modified so that the chosen element ha the desired correlation in it  but the change in the correlation matrix is the  smallest  possible  in the sense of matrix norm   this is my next step to do for this spreadsheet     just one column  and the corresponding row  of course  will change  while the rest of the matrix will stay unchanged  kevin  s suggestion   in this case the user have to choose which column  and row  he prefers to modify  in my example  column  row  or column  row    we can discus this approach with risk control and see how they like it  i send you only the spreadsheet with an example now  tanya

subject  re  outage tracker option and background karl  thanks a lot  i have passed this information to grant masson who worked here on a related problem  he will get in touch with you regarding this technology  vince karl tomlinson  enron _ development         pm to  vince j kaminski  ect cc  subject  outage tracker option and background vince  to follow up on the idea of a mean for effectively tracking instantanious plant faliure utilising either system frequency or connection point voltage  the system frequency phase shift across a network will probably be the best option a this would allow alll significant deviation to be tracked along with relative network performance from a few point  i am currently chasing nemmco  au system operator  to get hold of a few week of  second metering data for the whole system to see if there is enough measurement consistency to prove one of the idea  the idea follows along the line  literally   that when a unit fails it will introduce a shock into the system and reduce system frequency  which is then reacted to by frequency control service offered in by generator  the drop in frequency is noticable across the whole network and a one option may change the phase shift across the whole grid  the phase shift across the network is constantly changing due to load and power factor correctrion device switching on and off  however a unit failure may be distinct  the second option relates to how a unit fails  whereby if a circuit breaker is involved a in the case of uncontrolled shutdown  then the outage will cause an rf pulse that should propogate across some of the network  transformer will attenuate the pulse  however it should be detectable many mile away from the fault location  measure the arrival time at several point on the network  work out the shift and backtrack on the network  part of the solution is already proven in lightning tracker  the solution may be made more simple by detecting the exact point on the sinewave that the unit failed  i  e  measuring the three phase at lmhz and then sending the data through a dsp   this solution is more complex  however this should allow unit failure to be pinpointed to a station  the timing base for each of the node may be sourced from gps timing  self locating at the same time  will send you some link and document for potentail hardware and setup  karl

subject  proj  x analytics diligence paul  vince and i spent some time thinking about the diligence process for the trading analytics  there is a limited amount that can be accomplished in a two day time period  i think a reasonable start would be the following    obtain an audited history of the trading strategy which have been implemented in order to verify profitability  and p  l volatility of each    review needed working capital and risk capital requirement and compare these to projection for trading income    review current level of access to electronic market and verify that a change of ownership would not have adverse consequence  i  e  are there guarantee of continued access using the current system    review feasibility of entry into proposed new market  it is far from clear that there will be any synergy with most commodity market given the current limited  electronic  liquidity    review  at least qualitatively  the current trading strategy being used  try to develop some estimate of how fast the profitability of these strategy will disappear a other  s implement similar trading model  what is the trade off between trade quantity and slippage    review the methodology used to generate new trading strategy which will be needed to replace the current model a they become unprofitable and outdated    try to determine if there will be any value in transfer of trading technology to enron  s other market  given the illiquidity of these market a compared to the financial equity market  if there were a sufficiently long time horizon for our analysis  we would probably want to run their system on a test set of data  let me know if you have other suggestion    stinson
